Function Documentation

srRetVal getCurrTime (  int *  year,
int *  month,
int *  day,
int *  hour,
int *  minute,
int *  second,
int *  secfrac,
int *  secfracPrecison,
char *  pcOffsetMode,
int *  pOffsetHour,
int *  pOffsetMinute
) 
 

Get the current date/time in the best resolution the operating system has to offer (well, actually at most down to the milli- second level.

The date and time is returned in separate fields as this is most portable and removes the need for additional structures (but I have to admit it is somewhat "bulky";)).

Obviously, all caller-provided pointers must not be NULL...
